articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends books, CDs and equipment to Grand People's Study House 
    Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent many books and CDs on computer science and technology and equipment to the Grand People's Study House.
 He sent them to the house on over 70 occasions last and this years.    
 Those books and CDs such as "computer essentials", "computer communication and information" and "computer dictionary" greatly help working people have a good command of computer and widely apply up-to-date science and information technology to their work.

articles.title: Cultural heritages well preserved
articles.content:
Multimedia program "Korean Stamp" developed 
    Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Korean Stamp Corporation has recently developed a multimedia program "Korean Stamp."
 It shows a collection of stamps published till Juche 89 (2000) since March 12, Juche 35 (1946) when stamps on the rose of Sharon and the Samson rock were printed for the first time in Korea. It consists of "common sense of stamp", "revolutionary history seen on stamps", "classification of themes", "yearly classification" and "combined selection."    
 The staff members of the corporation succeeded in making this multimedia program comprising at least 25,000 pieces of scanned information, animation file, sound and music and historic materials.
